name: Interpretation Operator Axiom
intent: Define Φ as the first-stage interpreter that turns raw deviations into structured representations.
constraints: Φ: D \-\> R must be structure-preserving (continuous, linear, or functorial) relative to the semantic structure on D and R.
Φ must be selective: Ker(Φ) is a proper subset of D and Im(Φ) is not a singleton.
Φ must satisfy an interpretive stability bound: ||Φ(d \+ ε) \- Φ(d)|| ≤ K ||ε|| for some K \> 0.
Φ induces an equivalence relation on D where d \~ d' iff Φ(d) \= Φ(d'). The quotient D/\~ defines semantic deviation classes.
